thread.title: Standing Rock Water Protectors Evicted But Vow to Fight On
thread.title_full: Standing Rock Water Protectors Evicted But Vow to Fight On

title: Standing Rock Water Protectors Evicted But Vow to Fight On

organizations.name: social movements in defense of humanity

text:
Brian Becker 0 17 0 0 On today's episode of Loud & Clear, Brian Becker is joined by Kandi Mossett, an activist with the Indigenous Environmental Network. / 
After months of peaceful protest, the water protectors at Standing Rock were targeted for eviction by law enforcement and the government, but the struggle is going forward. 
Geneva peace talks aimed at ending Syriaâ€™s nearly six year war will reconvene today more than a year after the last round ended unsuccessfully. Is there a new US policy? Are Iranian-Turkish relations also suddenly strained as Trump takes aim at Iran and what might that mean for an end to the war in Syria? John Wight , host of Radio Sputnik's Hard Facts, joins the show to discuss. 
Secretary of State Rex Tillerson and Secretary of Homeland Security John Kelly are in Mexico for two days of talks after President Nieto cancelled his White House visit. Mexican people are in the streets. They are angry not just at Trump but at their own government. Might there a massive cross border movement of protest and resistance? James Cockroft , a founder of the Network of Intellectuals, Artists, and Social Movements in Defense of Humanity, discusses the importance of the meeting. 
We'd love to get your feedback at 
Have you heard the news? Sign up to our Telegram channel and we'll keep you up to speed! ...
